1→Hey everyone,
     2→
     3→I'm proud to present something I've been working on: **Side-by-Side Blueprint** — a pure Lean port of LeanBlueprint with an integrated deployment pipeline. No Python, no external dependencies, just Lake and Lean.
     4→
     5→This takes first steps toward some of the Lean FRO goals Leo mentioned at Lean Together 2026. The highlights:
     6→
     7→**User-Facing Features:**
     8→- **Side-by-side proof display** — LaTeX theorem statements paired with Lean code, toggleable proof bodies
     9→- **Project dashboard** — Key theorems, blocked items, messages, and technical debt at a glance
    10→- **Interactive dependency graph** — Status-colored nodes, click-through to theorems, cycle detection
    11→- **Integrated paper generation** — Same pipeline produces blueprint, HTML paper, and PDF
    12→- **6-tier status tracking** — From "not ready" through "mathlib-ready", auto-detected from your code
    13→- **One-click websites** — CI action generates and deploys everything
    14→
    15→**Example repos:**
    16→- [Minimal test repo](https://e-vergo.github.io/SBS-Test/index.html) — Shows all features
    17→- [GCR](https://e-vergo.github.io/General_Crystallographic_Restriction/index.html) — Complete project with blueprint + paper
    18→- [PNT](https://e-vergo.github.io/PrimeNumberTheoremAnd/index.html) — Full-scale existing project
    19→
    20→**Why not just use LeanBlueprint?**
    21→- **Pure Lean** — No Python install, no version mismatches, simpler CI
    22→- **Integrated pipeline** — Blueprint, paper, and PDF from the same build
    23→- **Richer metadata** — Dashboard messaging, debt tracking, status progression
    24→
    25→**Technical stack** (for the curious):
    26→- [LeanArchitect](https://github.com/e-vergo/LeanArchitect) — General-purpose tagging system (`@[blueprint]` attribute)
    27→- [Dress](https://github.com/e-vergo/Dress) — Extracts and "dresses" Lean with reusable assets during elaboration
    28→- [Runway](https://github.com/e-vergo/Runway) — The LeanBlueprint port; builds blueprint, dependency graph, paper
    29→- [dress-blueprint-action](https://github.com/e-vergo/dress-blueprint-action) — CI action for easy integration
    30→
    31→**Caveats:** It's entirely vibe coded and not ready for prime time, but it could be with some work. Looking for feedback on what features matter most and what rough edges need smoothing first.
    32→
    33→Happy to answer questions!
    34→
    35→Best,
    36→Eric
    37→
    38→*Screenshots below: Dashboard view, dependency graph, side-by-side proof display*
    39→

1→# SubVerso (Side-by-Side Blueprint Fork)
     2→
     3→**Upstream:** [leanprover/subverso](https://github.com/leanprover/subverso) by David Thrane Christiansen
     4→
     5→**Parent project:** [Side-by-Side Blueprint](https://github.com/e-vergo/Side-By-Side-Blueprint)
     6→
     7→## Fork Purpose
     8→
     9→SubVerso extracts semantic syntax highlighting from Lean info trees. In blueprint artifact generation, **highlighting accounts for 93-99% of total build time** (800-6500ms per declaration). The original implementation traverses info trees repeatedly, which becomes prohibitive at scale.

input_full.retrospective_content:
# Retrospective: GitHub Repo Name Alignment (Issue #231)

## What happened
VSCode GitHub Issues extension wasn't populating because the extension was querying `e-vergo/Side-By-Side-Blueprint` while the actual GitHub repo is `e-vergo/SLS-Strange-Loop-Station`. The repo was renamed at some point but references throughout the codebase weren't updated.

## What changed
Updated 21 files across the monorepo to reference `e-vergo/SLS-Strange-Loop-Station`:
- **VSCode settings** — Fixed the immediate user-facing issue (queries now target correct repo)
- **MCP server** — `GITHUB_REPO` constants in `sbs_tools.py` and `skill_tools.py`
- **Python CLI** — Default repo in `cli.py` and `labels/sync.py`
- **JSON schemas** — `$id` fields in 4 schema files
- **READMEs** — 9 files across toolchain/, showcase/, and forks/
- **Agent docs** — `sbs-developer.md` gh command examples
- **MCP test + README** — Test fixtures and documentation
- **Lean source** — `Runway/Paper.lean` link

## What was NOT changed
- Archive data (historical JSON entries) — immutable records
- Claude session data — historical
- Archived skill definitions — historical
- Local directory name (`Side-By-Side-Blueprint`) — user decided to keep as-is
- `CLAUDE.md` path references — still valid since directory wasn't renamed

## Scope
Closes #231 (VSCode extension now correctly queries the repo)
